title: The history of daylight saving time and its effect on our health

media:group.media:title: The history of daylight saving time and its effect on our health
media:group.media:description:
This weekend, nearly all of us will set our clocks back one hour. It's part of the twice-a-year ritual of alternating between daylight saving time and standard time. William Brangham looks at the history of changing the clock and a movement to do away with this process, once and for all.

Editor's Note: This report contained an error in that it misspelled Senator Patty Murray (D-Washington) name in the lower third font. We apologize for the mistake.
